description: The Pip-Boy 3000 was widely regarded as a pinnacle of durable personal electronic equipment, boasting a highly detailed biometric monitor, personal ledger, global positioning system, radio and general information processor. Although Pip-Boys are often durable enough to resist the ravages of nuclear devastation, they are still quite rare, and as such must be shepherded on account of the unique set of functions they can perform. Produced by the famed RobCo industries.
A central processor unit for a vault water purification system, necessary for a vault to produce potable water.

An old holotape detailing an expedition undertaken by the Brotherhood of Steel to a place called the West-Tek Research Facility. Probably of worth to somebody, assuming they can even get to it without becoming a victim of radiation poisoning.

This is a holotape containing a map of the local area. Produced by vault-tec before the great war, it contains the locations of vaults from the surrounding area.  Using it will add points of interest to your map.

use_action.message: You add the locations of various vaults to your map.

description: A Wattz Electronics Micromanipulator FingerStuff electronic lockpick. For defeating electronic locks and security devices.

Developed by Wattz electronics, this electronic safecracker features a suite of software and interface tooling to assist in opening any mechanical safe available on the common market. Why such a device was made in the first place is anyone's guess.

A very rare and mysterious device, the Mesmetron is a 'non-lethal subjugation device' developed by Implied Hypnotics, Inc before the great war for use by the United States military. The device functons by sending electro-magnetic signals to the synapses of its target, resulting in them entering a more compliant state for a period of time.
You activate the mesmetron, and a wave of electromagnetic energy flies out towards the target!

Creates a field of radiation that bends lightwaves around the user of a stealth boy, allowing one to hide your visual presence to others.  Colloquially known as invisibility, but without all the science mumbo jumbo.
message: To the outside world, your body fades away and you cease to exist!

description: Reverse engineered by the Robco Engineer Robert Mayflower from captured chinese technology, the Stealth Boy Mk.I is a stealth augmentation device that utilizes a complex modulation field to redirect light around its user, rendering the stealth boy operator invisible to all but the most perceptive of enemies. As these early stealth boys were extremely difficult to manufacture, they have a complex power source with limited charges. Activate the stealth boy to create the invisibility field.

Reverse engineered by the Robco Engineer Robert Mayflower from captured chinese technology, the Stealth Boy Mk.II is a stealth augmentation device that utilizes a complex modulation field to redirect light around its user, rendering the stealth boy operator invisible to all but the most perceptive of enemies. This is a later design of stealth boy, and although it's bulkier and has a shorter duration stealth field, it can actually run on conventional (albeit heavy) power sources. Activate the stealth boy to create the invisibility field.
A large Radiation King television.
A small radiation king radio. Enemy of certain youtuber who fears copyright claims.
This looks like a small box with a variety of vacuum tubes, cables and sensors arranged around its perimeter. Apparently it's to be used to regulate the pumping capacity of windmills.
A small box containing various vials of chemicals. These chemicals, although generally worthless on their own, can be used as reagents for a wide variety of products in the medical health industry.

A series of actuators, pistons, servos mounted onto a large metal arm. It's made of sterilized plastic and anti-microbial metal and is used as the primary arm for the auto-doc automatic medical system.
An old holotape detailing shipping between various wattz electronic stores in the New England Commonwealth.
An old holotape found in a vault that has data bypass information.

A Garden of Eden Creation Kit. Developed by Vault-Tec on the eve of the Great War, these suitcase devices are capable of revitalizing an entire stretch of barren land so it can become fertile with life once again. Contains a microfusion reactor and a wide variety of cryogenically frozen seed and feedstock to jumpstart any community.
A complex arrangement of vacuum tubes and transistors for use with ZAX series mainframe processors.
An old holotape found in a vault that has data bypass information.
A sealed wooden box with the stamp of the Crimson Caravan Company on its top. Any attempt to open the package would damage its seal, thus rendering any transport mission worthless.

1$ NCR. Legal tender for the world of the wastes. Or. It would be, if you were in California, Nevada, Arizona, or Oregon, instead of the eternal plane of New England. Still seems to be worth something.
A silver coin from a post-cataclysm civilization out west. How it got here, you don't know. Still seems to be worth something.
A golden coin from a post-cataclysm civilization out west. How it got here, you don't know. Still seems to be worth something.
A Nuka-Cola bottlecap. Still considered a form of monetary tender in some communities.
A special locket containing a small piece of paper with some numbers inscribed on it. Coordinates possibly?
